newsitem.title: UK: Northwest Europe oil, gas rigs up two at 65.
newsitem.headline: Northwest Europe oil, gas rigs up two at 65.

text.p: The number of active oil and gas rigs operating offshore Northwest Europe stood at 65 in the week ending June 11, up two from the previous week, consultants Arthur Andersen said.

There were 34 wells drilling in British waters, up one on the week ending June 4. The Norwegian sector was up one at 15 rigs. The Netherlands and Denmark were steady at 11 and four rigs respectively. Ireland was unchanged at one.

Arthur Andersen said in a weekly report that a few new spuds last week boosted the total number of exploration wells drilled to date in Northwest Europe. "Appraisal spuds for NWE are almost double those in the same period of 1996," the report said.
